item.title: Mini roudaout, 3rd February
item.description:
Hump roundabout and road markings completely disappeared due to weather/heavy traffic. Deep erosion appearing on busy junction. Wider area breaking up with large deep crakes/splits breaking out in tarmac. Dangerous on 3 way traffic junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackbrook Lane, Bickley, Greater London

item.title: Tree Replacement request, 3rd February
item.description:
Last month I requested a replacement tree at the rear of 33 Setchell Way SE1. I was told that as there is a mature tree behind this location there would not be a replacement tree. The mature tree has been cut down. Can you now please consider planting a replacement tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Curtis Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lead on turret looks like it could fall off and hit somebody underneath, 3rd February
item.description:
Roof of Beckenham Public Hall, 4 Bromley Road. There doesn't seem to be a category to flag this, so leaving here. Please see photos of lead that looks like it's slipping away. It will most like fall on to the cobble road below it, which is regularly used by pedestrians. If the lead fell on somebody ... it could well kill them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of rubbish on Hazel drive, 3rd February
item.description:
Would it be possible for someone to clear the rubbish along Hazel Drive towards the park. I have attached some photos. Thanks so much Matt

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazel Drive, Slade Green, Greater London

item.title: Pile of Road sweepings, 3rd February
item.description:
I am reporting this on behalf of my elderly mother who lives at 19 Forest Rd,DA8 2NS.Following the road being swept 19/01/2026 the contractor left a huge pile of road sweepings in the disabled bay outside my mother’s house.My mother reported this over the telephone on the same day and 3 more times since.She was promised action but the issue has still not been resolved.This Sunday(01/02/2026) a road sweeper came up Forest Road and ignored the pile in the road.My mother has a reference number of her first complaint 8699358.My mother is 86 years old and in my opinion this pile of rubbish is dangerous to her and others and I would like it noted that I have reported this problem should she have an incident.London Borough of Bexley have had sufficient time to resolve this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Road, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike frequently blocking pavement, 3rd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bennett Grove, Greater London
